Method Detail

pushManager

public static ETPush pushManager()
                          throws ETException
Primary accessor for the ETPush singleton. All Push interactions with ExactTarget should take place through this method. Before using this method, you must first call readyAimFire(Context, String, String, boolean, boolean, boolean) from your Application's Application.onCreate() method.

Returns:
ETPush singleton pushManager
Throws:
ETException

readyAimFire

public static void readyAimFire(Context applicationContext,
                                String etAppId,
                                String accessToken)
                         throws ETException
Call this from your Application's Application.onCreate() method. This initializes ETPush. Configures the SDK to point to the correct Code@ application. These credentials are provided by Code@ExactTarget, and are generated there. Best practice is to create two applications, one for a dev instance, and one for prod. This method automatically enables analytics and location services.

Parameters:
applicationContext -
etAppId - Generated application ID to identify with ExactTarget
accessToken - Generated token to allow access to the Fuel API
Throws:
ETException

readyAimFire

public static void readyAimFire(Context applicationContext,
                                String etAppId,
                                String accessToken,
                                boolean enableAnalytics,
                                boolean enableLocationManager,
                                boolean enableCloudPages)
                         throws ETException
Call this from your Application's Application.onCreate() method. This initializes ETPush. Configures the SDK to point to the correct Code@ application. These credentials are provided by Code@ExactTarget, and are generated there. Best practice is to create two applications, one for a dev instance, and one for prod.

Parameters:
applicationContext -
etAppId - Generated application ID to identify with ExactTarget
accessToken - Generated token to allow access to the Fuel API
enableAnalytics - true if each of your activities will be notifying ETAnalytics of app usage in onPause() and onResume()
enableLocationManager - true if the location manager or geofencing will be used
Throws:
ETException

isPushEnabled

public boolean isPushEnabled()
Checks persistent preferences for the state of Push. Push is enabled by either enablePush(Activity) or disablePush(Activity), and the SDK ships with Push disabled by default. Best practice dictates that the user gathers opt-in and explicitly enables Push.

Returns:
boolean The state of push, either on or off, as managed by the Push Manager.

enablePush

public void enablePush(Activity callingActivity)
                throws ETException
Enables push and push accessories in the SDK.

This method should be called when explicit permission for Push has been given by the user. No interface for this is provided. By comparison, iOS will prompt the user when an app wants to send Push notifications. As Android doesn't, you must do so on your own.

Parameters:
callingActivity - If googleplayservices library is outdated, a dialog box is placed on this activity to prompt the user to install it.
Throws:
ETException
See Also:
disablePush(Activity)

disablePush

public void disablePush(Activity callingActivity)
Disables push and push accessories in the SDK.

This method should be called if the user decided they no longer wish to receive Push notifications. To be compliant, you need to provide the user with means to disable Push.

Parameters:
callingActivity - If googleplayservices library is outdated, a dialog box is placed on this activity to prompt the user to install it.
See Also:
enablePush(Activity)

activityPaused

public void activityPaused(Activity activity)
Call this method from your Activity's onPause() method.

Parameters:
activity - The paused activity.

activityResumed

public void activityResumed(Activity activity)
Call this method from your Activity's onResume() method.

Parameters:
activity - The newly resumed activity.

setNotificationRecipientClass

public void setNotificationRecipientClass(Class<?> cls)
The Activity that should be activated when a notification is acted upon. If unspecified, default behavior is to launc the application's Launcher activity.

Parameters:
cls - Reference to the Activity you wish to launch.

getNotificationRecipientClass

public Class<?> getNotificationRecipientClass()
Getter for the notification recipient class. Used internally.

Returns:
Reference to the class that should be called when a notification is responded to

addAttribute

public void addAttribute(String attribute,
                         String value)
                  throws ETException
Adds an attribute to current user's Contact model.

This data is available in MobilePush, and will automatically map to any matching attribute within MobilePush/Contacts.

Note that attribute mapping is case sensitive, and spaces should be avoided.

Parameters:
attribute - Attribute name
value - Value to assign to that attribute for this user
Throws:
ETException

removeAttribute

public void removeAttribute(String attribute)
                     throws ETException
Removes an attribute from the current user's data, and prevents it from being sent to ExactTarget. This will also cause that attribute to be cleared in Contacts.

Note that attribute mapping is case sensitive, and spaces should be avoided.

Parameters:
attribute - Name of the attribute to remove.
Throws:
ETException

addTag

public void addTag(String tag)
            throws ETException
Adds a tag to the current user's Contact model.

This data will be available through MobilePush for use of creation of an audience.

Parameters:
tag - Name of the tag to be set
Throws:
ETException

removeTag

public void removeTag(String tag)
               throws ETException
Removes a tag from the current user's Contact model.

Parameters:
tag - Name of the tag to remove
Throws:
ETException

subKey - Value of the SubscriberKey

ETException

                      throws ETException
Returns the currently set device token for the registered device. If

Returns:
the device token, or empty string if the device is unregistered.

ETException

unregisterDeviceToken

public void unregisterDeviceToken()
                           throws ETException
Removes the device token from the user's data, effectively unregistering them from pushes.

Throws:
ETException

getOpenDirectRecipient

public Class<?> getOpenDirectRecipient()
Returns a pointer to the OpenDirect recipient class.

Returns:
the openDirectRecipient

setOpenDirectRecipient

public void setOpenDirectRecipient(Class<?> openDirectRecipient)
Sets the class that should receive the CloudPage message. It will be delivered a bundle with string extra "open_direct_payload" included. If not set, the system will default to using ETLandingPagePresenter to handle OpenDirect messages.

Parameters:
openDirectRecipient - the openDirectRecipient to set

getCloudPageRecipient

public Class<?> getCloudPageRecipient()
Returns a pointer to the CloudPage recipient class.

Returns:
the cloudPageRecipient

setCloudPageRecipient

public void setCloudPageRecipient(Class<?> cloudPageRecipient)
Sets the class that should receive the CloudPage message. It will be delivered a bundle with string extra "loadURL" included. If not set, the system will default to using ETLandingPagePresenter to handle CloudPage messages.

Parameters:
cloudPageRecipient - the cloudPageRecipient to set

setNotificationAction

public void setNotificationAction(String notificationAction)
Sets the action parameter of the intent to be fired when a notification is received. For example, you might pass something like Intent.ACTION_VIEW. You must also call setNotificationActionUri(Uri) to launch a notification intent using this method.

Parameters:
notificationAction -

setNotificationActionUri

public void setNotificationActionUri(Uri notificationActionUri)
Sets the Intent data URI to use when a notification is clicked. You must also call setNotificationAction(String) to launch a notification intent using this method.

Parameters:
notificationActionUri -
